meanings.definition: A reduction in the amount or extent of something.
meanings.sent1: The cutback in staff led to longer wait times.
meanings.sent2: The company had to implement a cutback in expenses to stay afloat.
meanings.sent3: The cutback in dessert portions left everyone craving more.
meanings.sent4: Her cutback in screen time resulted in improved focus.
meanings.sent5: The cutback in sugar intake made a noticeable difference in her health.

meanings.definition: A decrease in spending or production.
meanings.sent1: The cutback in production was necessary due to low demand.
meanings.sent2: The government announced a cutback in public spending.
meanings.sent3: The cutback in chocolate consumption caused a stir among the group.
meanings.sent4: His cutback in work hours impacted his income significantly.
meanings.sent5: The cutback in oil production led to a rise in prices.

meanings.definition: To reduce or decrease in size, amount, or extent.
meanings.sent1: She decided to cutback on unnecessary expenses.
meanings.sent2: The team had to cutback on the number of projects to meet deadlines.
meanings.sent3: He tried to cutback on his video game time but found it challenging.
meanings.sent4: The company had to cutback on staff to save costs.
meanings.sent5: To improve his health, he had to cutback on unhealthy snacks.

meanings.definition: To make a reduction in spending or production.
meanings.sent1: The company had to cutback on advertising to balance the budget.
meanings.sent2: They decided to cutback on the number of products to focus on quality.
meanings.sent3: She had to cutback on shopping to save money for the trip.
meanings.sent4: The factory had to cutback on production due to a shortage of materials.
meanings.sent5: To meet the new regulations, they had to cutback on emissions.
